result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. THOMAS MICHAEL FORRESTAL

records.addlTxt:
10:58 AM Defendant THOMAS MICHAEL FORRESTAL in court.  Attorney Scott S. Schlough in court for THOMAS MICHAEL FORRESTAL.  Attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for State of Wisconsin. 
22CF404, 22CF405, 21CF785
Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights. 
Defendant informed of charges and penalties. 
Acknowledges prior conviction(s). 
Count 1, OWI 8, .130, Defendant enters no contest plea. 
Factual basis and probable cause found. 
Court accepts plea as voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made and finds defendant guilty. 

21CF785, Count 2 DRI. 22CF404, 22CF405, Uncharged DA Case 22CH1858, & 21TR4706 DRI.

Court orders: 

36 mo IC, 60 mo ES, consecutive to any other sentence 

$2327 fine
$250 DNA
$36.40 BAC
Lifetime driver's license revocation 
12 mo IID 
DNA
AODA/DSP

Conditions of ES: drinks, drugs, para, norx, sale, nodl, drive, assess
2 days credit 

Off record, per Judge Isaacson, cash bond to be applied to fine and costs.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence Jean Broeren in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant THOMAS MICHAEL FORRESTAL in court.  Attorney Scott S. Schlough in court for THOMAS MICHAEL FORRESTAL. Close to resolution. Arraignments to be scheduled with JA outside of intake.

BOND APPLIES TO 21CF785 (amended), 22CF404 (new) & 22CF405 (new).
Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions.
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
Defendant .shall not go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid drivers license.
Daily PBTs at CHSO.
